definition: turbulent situation/changing (face, scene, situation, world of etc)
to change/to become different/to transform/to vary/rebellion
office/situation/classifier for games: match, set, round etc

sentences.english: The way I see it is Japan has finally had its post–World War II political upheaval.
sentences.chinese: 在我看来，日本终于要面对二战之后的政治大变局了。

sentences.english: The period of the Northern Warlords' rule over China was an era of a great change.
sentences.chinese: 北洋军阀统治时期，是个大变局时代。

sentences.english: How do you see political change coming in China?
sentences.chinese: 对于未来中国的政治变局，你怎么看？

sentences.english: Deutsche added that it could be a "a game-change for the EU gas market."
sentences.chinese: 德意志银行还指出，这可能导致欧洲天然气市场变局。

sentences.english: How to evaluate the influence of economic change on online advertising?
sentences.chinese: 如何评估经济变局对在线广告市场的影响？

sentences.english: Change could happen as unexpectedly as it did in 1989.
sentences.chinese: 1989年那样出人意料的变局会浮出水面。

sentences.english: What's the digital marketing strategy for brand Communications under economic transition?
sentences.chinese: 经济变局下，品牌传播策略出现了什么新变化？

definition: to surge like a gathering storm (idiom)/to grow by leaps and bounds
variant of 動蕩|动荡[dong4 dang4]
Vertical and Horizontal Alliance, opposing stratagems devised by the School of Diplomacy 縱橫家|纵横家[Zong4 heng2 jia1] during the Warring States Period (425-221 BC)
great heroes pursue deer in the central plains (idiom); fig. many vie for supremacy
to discard the old and introduce the new (idiom); to innovate
